result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharlon R Garrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant. 
 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 7 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Mashele F.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation, if revoked by DOC, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
 
Court does not object to sentence being transferred to the State of Illinois.  

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

- Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Sharlon R Garrett in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.
filed.  Theft, PTAC, AS PARTY TO A CRIME,  contrary to sec. 943.20 (1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05 Wis. Stats., a Class A misdemeanor.

*CASE BEFORE BRANCH 21 FOR BRANCH 26*

Matter calendared for Bail/bond hearing.  Attorney Carpenter appointed to this matter very recently.  Defense indicates that the case is scheduled for preliminary hearing on 4-16-15; parties agree to address bail on that date.  Case remains set on 4-16-15 at 1:30 p.m. before Preliminary Hearing Court.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Sharlon R Garrett in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Sharlon R Garrett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am in Branch 21 for Branch 26.
